title: Scrapes ECAC Hockey Team Data
text: ecacr intended allow R users create introductory data visualizations ECAC Hockey teams, games, players. ecacr makes intensive use tidyverse, including dplyr, stringr, ggplot2. Keep reading see can use ecacr.

title: Scrapes ECAC Hockey Team Data
text: ecacr provides two data visualization templates team level data. scatterPlot() creates ggplot2 scatter plot season summary statistics ECAC teams. Helps highlight relationships (lack thereof) two summary statistics. lollipopChart() creates ggplot2 lollipop chart (minimalist alternative bar chart) allowing comparison ECAC teams given statistic.

title: Scrapes ECAC Hockey Team Data
text: ecacr provides two functions data visualizations game level data boxplot() creates ggplot2 boxplot grouped ECAC team. Shows distribution given variable course entire season. winLossChart() creates ggplot2 bar chart visualizes win/loss habits single ECAC team entire season. Can faceted home/away.

title: Scrapes ECAC Hockey Team Data
text: ecacr also provides two data visualizations individual player data histogram() creates ggplot2 histogram shows distribution given stat across ECAC players. overallLeaders() creates ggplot2 lollipop chart (modified bar chart) overall ECAC leaders given stat category

title: Scrapes ECAC Hockey Team Data
text: ecacr makes use rvest produce variety web scraping functions. used internally previous data visualization functions prior ggplot2 experience. Use functions scrape data manually create visualizations. scrapeTeamStats() team level data scrapeGameStats() scrapeGameStatsByTeam() game level data scrapeIndivStats() scrapeIndivStatsByTeam() player level data

title: Scrapes ECAC Hockey Team Data
text: sample visualizations can create ecacr. examples, click documentation individual function.
code: # Team Visualizations lollipopChart(var="Assists") scatterPlot(x="Shots", y="Goals", trend=TRUE, dynamic=FALSE) # Game Visualizations winLossChart(team="stlawrence", gender="men", byLocation=TRUE) boxplot(var="PenaltyMinutes", verbose=FALSE) # Individual Visualizations overallLeaders(var="Goals", games="conference", players="skaters", verbose=FALSE) histogram(var="Shots", players="skaters", verbose=FALSE)

title: Scrapes ECAC Hockey Team Data

what: Produce a Chart of Individual Overall Season Leaders — overallLeaders
title: Produce a Chart of Individual Overall Season Leaders — overallLeaders
text: Creates ggplot2 lollipop chart (bar chart alternative) object. Displays overall individual leaders given player statistic. Also provides player's team.

title: Produce a Chart of Individual Overall Season Leaders — overallLeaders
code: overallLeaders(   var,   n_leaders = 10,   games = "all",   players = "goalies",   gender = "women",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Produce a Chart of Individual Overall Season Leaders — overallLeaders
text: var summary statistic plot n_leaders number leaders plot (default 10) games graphing '' (default), 'conference', 'nonconference' games. Currently support 'nonconference' games players type players stats graph, 'goalies' (default) 'skaters' gender 'women' (default) 'men' verbose TRUE (default) intermediate data scraping output messages, FALSE additional output

what: Scrape Individual Player Statistics For One Team — scrapeIndivStatsByTeam
title: Scrape Individual Player Statistics For One Team — scrapeIndivStatsByTeam
text: Webscrape (using rvest) individual player statistics given team current season

title: Scrape Individual Player Statistics For One Team — scrapeIndivStatsByTeam
code: scrapeIndivStatsByTeam(   team,   games = "all",   players = "goalies",   gender = "women" )

title: Scrape Individual Player Statistics For One Team — scrapeIndivStatsByTeam
text: team ECAC team scrape data games collecting data '' (default), 'conference', 'nonconference' games. Currently support 'nonconference' games players type players stats collect, 'goalies' (default) 'skaters' gender 'women' (default) 'men'

title: Scrape Individual Player Statistics For One Team — scrapeIndivStatsByTeam

title: Check Team Name Validity — teamIsValid
text: Checks provided team name

title: Check Team Name Validity — teamIsValid
code: teamIsValid(team)

title: Check Team Name Validity — teamIsValid
text: team team name check

title: Check Team Name Validity — teamIsValid
text: TRUE team ECAC formatted correctly, FALSE otherwise

title: Check Team Name Validity — teamIsValid
code: teamIsValid(team="rensselaer") # TRUE #> Error in teamIsValid(team = "rensselaer"): could not find function "teamIsValid" teamIsValid(team="RIT") # FALSE #> Error in teamIsValid(team = "RIT"): could not find function "teamIsValid"

title: Check Variable Name Validity — varIsValid
text: Checks validity given variable name certain type ECAC hockey data

title: Check Variable Name Validity — varIsValid
code: varIsValid(variableName, type)

title: Check Variable Name Validity — varIsValid
text: variableName name Variable check type type variable check ('team', 'skaters', 'goalies', ' game')

title: Check Variable Name Validity — varIsValid
text: TRUE variableName valid, FALSE otherwise

title: Check Variable Name Validity — varIsValid
code: varIsValid(variableName="Goals", type="skaters") # TRUE #> Error in varIsValid(variableName = "Goals", type = "skaters"): could not find function "varIsValid" varIsValid(varaibleName="Assists", type="goalies") # FALSE #> Error in varIsValid(varaibleName = "Assists", type = "goalies"): could not find function "varIsValid"

what: Produce a Win/Loss ggplot2 Bar Chart — winLossChart
title: Produce a Win/Loss ggplot2 Bar Chart — winLossChart

text: team ECAC team visualize gender 'women' (default) 'men' byLocation TRUE (default) split Home/Away, FALSE otherwise

title: Produce a Win/Loss ggplot2 Bar Chart — winLossChart
text: ggplot2 bar chart object

title: Produce a Win/Loss ggplot2 Bar Chart — winLossChart
code: winLossChart(team="brown")  winLossChart(team="clarkson", gender="men", byLocation=FALSE)
